snippet: Human Rights Watch said it had documented for the first time that rebel groups in Syria “systematically” targeted civilians in a massacre in August that left 190 dead.
abstract: Human Rights Watch reports that Syrian rebels killed 190 civilians in village of Latakia while fighting off small garrison of government troops; killings, first documented on such large scale, are being called crime against humanity; disclosures cast doubt on effectiveness of Western efforts to keep opposition in check.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad and an employee of The New York Times contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Human Rights Watch said it had documented for the first time that rebel groups in Syria “systematically” targeted civilians in a massacre in August that left 190 dead.

headline.main: Syrian Civilians Bore Brunt of Rebels’ Fury, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Syrian Civilians, Report Says, Bore Brunt of Rebel Fury
